column4: For an unknown reason my network applet doesn't show any Ethernet connection anymore, what should I do?
do you have an entry for it in /etc/network/interfaces ?
no, but neither for eth1 which the applet shows (but I can't see my router there)
if you do, thats why. but you don't so its ok
if you run:  sudo lshw -C network    websearch for the product line of the wired connection for guides
lshw shows only eth1 (without naming it)
you will need a ppa
then reboot and run:  dmesg | less     and read through, see if your ethernet port is detected at boot and if there are any issues with it
what is a ppa? but dmesg after a reboot said something like 'udev: eth0 renamed to eth1' (eth1 is the wireless card after the boot)
sounds like the wifi is being named as et0 but the wired is usually eth0, is the wired connection enabled in bios?
the card worked fine yesterday ; I will check the BIOS
wired not disabled in BIOS ; I just disabled "power saving" to be sure
good move
is the system a laptop or branded pc?
HP dv6 laptop ; has a "disable wifi" button and some quirks
greta, let me search
do you dual boot?
yes
windows 7, ubuntu Lucid ; I have three kernels installed, and tested the last two

ok the windows boot may be tying up the device, head into device manager and disable power saving on the device as well as uncheck the box to allow the device to wake windows up. Windows is screwing te hardware up
octavio-rdz : unchecked, and it worked ; thank you very much for your patience and $&#@ windows !
yep :(
